snippet: The order was a blow to opponents of such requirements, who had been heartened by a lower court’s finding that the law had abridged citizens’ right to vote.
abstract: Federal appeals court permits Wisconsin to restore a requirement that voters provide photo identification before casting election ballots, allowing the long-debated state law to take effect in time for a hard-fought election on Nov 4; order is seen as a significant victory for advocates of such voting requirements; opponents of the laws had viewed the Wisconsin case as opening a novel legal basis for their efforts in federal courtrooms.
lead_paragraph: The order was a blow to opponents of such requirements, who had been heartened by a lower court’s finding that the law had abridged citizens’ right to vote.

headline.main: Federal Appeals Court Permits Wisconsin Voter ID Law
headline.print_headline: Voter ID Law in Wisconsin Is Permitted on Appeal
